dialogues.BOBBY GREEN:
[1]...you're so fuckin' beautiful, you know that...? 
[2]I'll be out in a second, Louis! 
[3]What the fuck's goin' on in here? 
[4]Yeah--just keep that wide load of yours outta trouble, arright? 
[5]What're you doing?!? You gotta behave yourself here! 
[6]Well now you're gonna do nothing someplace else! Now listen--one of these days I'm gonna run this whole block, and I see any you in here again--any you-- I'll bust your fuckin' hole! Throw `em out on their ass. I gotta go upstairs, drop off my keys with the old man. 
[7]Mr. Buzhayev, how are you! 
[8]Listen, Mr. Buzhayev--I gotta go do something right now. But don't worry--everything's in good shape downstairs. 
[9]You remember what I tol' you? 
[10]Nobody knows about my father and my brother--not even Jumbo. And it's gotta stay that way, you understand? 
[11]Nah.   Nah, I'm managing now. 
[12]Yeah. I'll see you `round, arright? 
[13]I changed my name--I use my mother's name now. It's better for business. C'mon... 
[14]That's them there. In the corner. Lookit `em--two peas in a pod. 
[15][My] Father's friends--they were all in Korea together. Biggest bunch of fuckin' stiffs... Look, don't talk to nobody, we'll get out quicker. 
[16]N--I just wanna get out quick, that's all... 
[17]Yeah I did so...congratulations... 
[18]Pop. Everybody, this is my girlfriend. Rosario. 
[19]This's my brother. And my father. 
[20]I know. I like it this way. That why you got me up here?    [To] tell me my hair's too long? 
[21]Whatsamatter? 
[22]That's a good hook for you. 
[23]You ever talk? 
[24]A favor? Oh, he needs a favor! 
[25]You cut me off financially, and now you need the favor? `S interesting. 
[26]`S good lookin' boy! 
[27]I don't know nothing about that. 
[28]The old man?! What, you been watching us?!? 
[29]What the fuck is this? 
[30]You kidding me? Inform for you?!? That's what you wanted me here for? 
[31]Yeah well, find another way. I got a lot invested in that club and I can't let it get fucked up. 
[32][You] Fuckin' broadsided me... Everything's about the goddamned job with you. 
[33]C'mon... Get off your fuckin' high horse and bust somebody else's balls. 
[34]You're welcome. 
[35]'S that supposed to mean?!? 
[36]Congratulations. You got me up here. 
[37]Good.   Then now you know. 
[38]Yeah.   I like the dark meat. 
[39]Why, you want some? 
[40]I gotta go, Pop. I'll see you `round. 
[41]C'mon, let's get outta here, [we'll] go party with Jumbo. 
[42]We're goin'. C'mon. 
[43]You're just like her, baby... 
[44]That's cool. 
[45]It's all right--they don't like nobody outside their own little world. 
[46]My brother and my father ain't like that. It's just--the whole thing ain't for me, that's all. 
[47]You know how gorgeous you are? 
[48]What is it? 
[49]...it's beautiful... 
[50]...you're so good to me... 
[51]Only if you behave yourself... 
[52]Uh oh--[The] party's really gonna get started now! 
[53]Any Spanish Fly in there for you? 
[54]I'm goin' up to see Buzhayev tonight. I think he's gonna ask me to buy into the club. 
[55]I'll show you a fuckin' faggot! 
[56]Everybody, I gotta be at El Caribe in an hour, so get ready! 
[57]No no, I'm all right... Hi everybody... 
[58]Everything's really rockin' tonight. Line's halfway `round the block. 
[59]You wanted to talk to me? 
[60]'S a good move. 
[61]I appreciate that. You know, I been thinking `bout it--I'd like to become a partner here too--buy in with you. I mean, I got a lot of ideas. 
[62]Well, I just think we could do more. Maybe expand into Sheepshead Bay. I know a good spot--we add a restaurant there, get the spill- over. Like what your brother did, in Miami. 
[63]I can understand that. But I got money to invest--we could make it something real special over there. Do what I did downstairs--you know, bring in name DJs on different nights? What do you think? 
[64]Yeah, sure.   I'll come. 
[65]Nah nah, no thank you... 
[66]Listen--I get this done, I want you to be a host. In one of our spots. 
[67]Well, just make sure you get your old co-workers from the Health Department to give us a pass on the kitchen. 
[68]Where's Rosario? 
[69]Goddamnit... [She's] With that fuckin' animal again. 
[70]Look at him... I'll tell you, [when] this is my place, we'll kick his fuckin' ass right outta here-- 
[71]Yeah, you know a lot. 
[72]You sure it wasn't your dick? 
[73]Shit... I'll be right back. 
[74]Things're goin' good. 
[75]He don't look like a middleweight no more. 
[76]Your uncle's a great man. Smart man. 
[77]Your uncle loses his license, he ain't gonna be too happy. 
[78]Yeah...I'll think about that. Rosario--I wanna talk to you. 
[79]You gotta stop dealing. You hear what I'm telling you? 
[80]You hear what I said? 
[81]Just hold off then, for a little while. Okay? I got my reasons. 
[82]Gimme your shit! 
[83]Thanks a lot.    I appreciate it. 
[84]Okay, I'll go thank him too then. He comes in, raids the fuckin' place--now I gotta go beg `em not to fire me-- 
[85]Fuck you, Pop.    Fuck the both of you's. 
[86]You fuckin' touch me!? You gonna fuckin' touch me?!? 
[87]Mr. Buzhayev... I'm real sorry about what happened the other night. [If] I was working, maybe I would've been able to do something, but... Anyway, I'm sorry. 
[88]You don't mind my saying, I think that's probably the right thing to do. Things get back to normal, I'm hoping we could get started on what we talked about. 
[89]Mr. Buzhayev, my getting arrested ain't gonna be a problem. I don't got a record-- 
[90]Yeah...   All right... 
[91]You had to hit that spot. 
[92]I had plans down there. 
[93]You got real balls saying that to me. I made something for myself, and you come in and fuck it up? Just `cause I'm not trying to be like you? And Pop-- 
[94]What did you call her? 
[95]You piece of shit... 
[96]Fine with me, you motherfucker! 
[97]That ain't nothing. 
[98]We'll see you and bump you two C's. 
[99]Siegfried and Roy, baby! Two fucking queens! 
[100]Who is it? 
[101]Hello? 
[102]Is--is he gonna be all right? 
[103]My brother was shot...they're operating on him now. 
[104]Game's over, everybody. 
[105]That's right.    I gotta go. 
[106]What're you doing? 
[107]No--it's gonna be a fuckin' scene. I'll call you later. 
[108]Don't argue. 
[109]Louis, lock up and take her home. 
[110]Yeah, no--I just remembered I gotta do something, that's all-- 
[111]Pop? 
[112]Pop, he all right? 
[113]I need to see him... 
[114]You guys blaming me for this? Is that it? 
[115]That's bullshit--she's clean.      You fuckin' keep away from her. 
[116]Yeah.   That's me. 
[117]Look--I'm his brother, you fuckin' hard-on! 
[118]...Feels like it was my fault... 
[119]Hercules, do me a favor--before you kill a waitress, go pay the check. 
[120]Don't tell Louis nothing about what happened. Far as he knows, my family moved away, [a] long time ago. 
[121]I didn't have nothing on me. 
[122]Your uncle's got some problems now, though. 
[123]Baby--why don't you go keep Jumbo company, make sure he leaves a tip. 
[124]It's a little dangerous right now, don't you think? 
[125]Muscle--? 
[126]A cop got hit today. They ain't never gonna sit still for that. 
[127]I'll see you around... 
[128]I need to find Deputy Chief Grusinsky. 
[129]Pop, I gotta talk to you. 
[130]It's important--I got information. 
[131]It's about you. 
[132]It's bad. 
[133]Yeah... 
[134]Pop, Nezhinski's been talkin' about a shipment he's got comin'. Maybe that's how you get to him. 
[135]They been wanting me to buy in for a while. 
[136]What do you mean, set something up? 
[137]Pop? 
[138]You could trust her. 
[139]But...but you could get killed-- 
[140]Your mother's real important to you, ain't she. You'd do anything for her. 
[141]Go back to sleep... 
[142]You been up to see my brother...? 
[143]...How's that been goin'...? 
[144]Well I... I been thinking...if you could keep it confidential...? I'd make the connection for you. 
[145]They trust me--we could go in large, use my money for the buy, they won't suspect anything-- 
[146]He don't gotta know anything about it. Does he? 
[147]I know. It's just--I realized... ....my father dies `cause of all this, I couldn't live my life knowing I coulda done something. I know the same is true for you.   I know it is. 
[148]So please--can we do this...? 
[149]Hey.  It's Bobby Green. I decided--I wanna buy in. 
[150]Fifty k, to start. 
[151]Sounds good. 
[152]Okay.   I'll see you tomorrow. 
[153]Most expensive phone call I ever made. 
[154]You need to promise me something, though. You won't investigate my girlfriend--she's, she don't know any better. 
[155]I'll take care of it. 
[156]You gonna leave me all alone out there? 
[157]You come up with that one all by yourself? 
[158]I--I need to talk to you. 
[159]I--I'm gonna inform. For the police. I'm gonna help `em set up Nezhinski. 
[160]I had to do it, Rosario. These motherfuckers--they were gonna come after my father. 
[161]He ain't ever gonna find out.    He ain't ever gonna know. 
[162]I don't know... I'd, I'd probably have to go into protection. 
[163]But that's never gonna happen! 
[164]Rosario, listen--I had to do it. 
[165]I had to do it... 
[166]Everything's gonna be all right... Don't worry, it'll be all right... 
[167]Yeah... Sorry, buddy--I got some legal shit to deal with, from the raid... But I ain't forgot about you--I'll be back soon. 
[168]No, it's okay--I'll talk to him later... 
[169]Where's Vadim. 
[170]Well, I got fifty grand in here. And it don't move `less I deal with the man himself. So [if] you're interested, I wanna see your stash, right now. No bullshit. 
[171]You know me. 
[172]That's all the money I got.    And I ain't gonna leave it alone. 
[173]From my savings. From El Caribe and Rasputin. 
[174]Sounds good. 
[175]I took a little taste. 
[176]I'm clean. 
[177]You wanna search me again, you go `head. I just wanna make this deal and go home. 
[178]I'm gonna get pussy from this... 
[179][When] this deal goes down, I'm, I'm gonna get a lotta pussy... 
[180]I'm with you!     I'm with YOU! 
[181]I'll be all right, Pop. 
[182]I need you to get my girlfriend, Pop. I need her to come with me. 
[183]Yeah. They let me come--long as I brought these guys with me. 
[184]Good... It's rehabbing good, for only nine weeks. Don't matter, I wasn't no Fred Astaire before. 
[185]Anyway, it ain't nothing compared to my brother, so... 
[186]Just hold on, `til he gets here. 
[187]I'm not sure yet... We been thinking about moving down to Miami. Guy I used to work for, his brother's got a place down there. 
[188]A lotta kids here, lotta family... It's nice, ain't it...? 
[189]You know how happy I am you're with me? 
[190]I'm real glad you're home... 
[191]What're you talking about? They got a lot of food over there--why don't you go eat something? 
[192]You fucked up? 
[193]We gotta straighten this out later. 
[194]That don't mean nothing. 
[195]There's a whole network full of suppliers. The organization goes deep. 
[196]I'll be outside if you need me. 
[197]Well, why's he goin' back to work so soon, anyway? He ain't ready. 
[198]
[199]No, come on! I don't want that! What I did, I did for you guys, this once. I got my own plans. 
[200]Take me back to the motel. 
[201]Rosario?    Rosario! 
[202]
[203]The cops're right outside--let's go. I said, let's go! 
[204]Lou--no more of this for her.   It's too fuckin' dangerous now. 
[205]Yeah--we'll talk later, buddy--I'll call you. But right now I need to get her outta here. 
[206]You gotta put everything in jeopardy? Huh? 
[207]You know, I don't think you realize how serious this is? 
[208]We gotta ride this out, `til this fuckin' thing is over. `Til I can get things back on track. 
[209]I know. But I'm workin' on it, I am. Soon as the trial's over and I get my money back outta impound-- everything'll get better, you'll see. 
[210]Rosario--once this's done, we'll go down to Miami... [It'll] be a new thing for us--a lotta opportunities... I'll talk to Mr. Buzhayev about working for his brother down there. We'll get your mother to come too-- I'll even talk to Jumbo about it. 
[211]C'mon... Let's go back--this'll all be over soon. I promise... 
[212]Thank you... You know Mr. Buzhayev, I come to see you today `cause...with everything that's gone on, I don't think it's a good idea for me to stay in New York anymore. I was hoping maybe you could ask your brother if I could work with him, down in Miami. On his restaurant. 
[213]I'd appreciate it. 
[214]You always been very important to me too. I should probably go now. 
[215]Yeah, maybe. Why don't we give `em all these bags to throw out--it's becoming a mess. 
[216]What's goin' on? 
[217]What--? 
[218]Jesus...   What about-- 
[219]You see something out there? 
[220]Pop?   Joe come close this morning? 
[221]Yeah, maybe.   But you know the way he is. 
[222]I know, Pop. 
[223]It's really coming down... 
[224]Hey--Vitt--I think somethin's on our right! 
[225]Get down! 
[226]Rosario!   You hurt? 
[227]Pop, lay back! 
[228]Don't fuckin' look at him! I said don't--back up! Don't look at him... 
[229]Does my brother know yet? 
[230]Then you gotta take me to him... I wanna go see him... 
[231]Joseph? 
[232]I don't know if I can do that.   I 
[233]I wanna stay close to you from now on, Joe... I wanna stay with you... 
[234]You gonna fuckin' catch these guys? 
[235]You ain't got nothing, do you. 
[236]You gotta find that spot... 
[237]Course... 
[238]No.... I did it to hurt him...   I disappointed him... 
[239]I can't live like this no more, Mike... They destroyed my family. There's a deal going down, I... I wanna help... 
[240]I, I could join you. 
[241]My Pop tol' me you pull guys outta the Academy, guys with special knowledge, [and] make `em cops? You could do that. 
[242]No.   I can't do nothing else now. 
[243]I know. 
[244]Joe, I'm gonna join you. I just decided... Okay? 
[245]This is where I belong... 
[246]I wanna talk to you about something. 
[247]I'm thinking of...maybe joining the Force. 
[248]I mean, I help find Nezhinski, we don't gotta live like this the rest of our lives--moving every three fuckin' days... 
[249]What're you talking about? I just got through telling you-- 
[250]
[251]Hold on a second--I know what I'm talking about'd be a change. It'd be a big change for us. 
[252]But we could make a life here. This'd be something we could build on. We could raise a family, and... 
[253]Pretty soon you'd fit in. 
[254]They'll accept you if we're 
[255]Gave it up? Gave up what? 
[256]What fuckin' life did you have? You're a fuckin' cokehead--look at you! 
[257]Well, maybe I was a piece of shit too! Wasting my goddamned time! 
[258]Wake up!   All that was nothing! 
[259]My brother's gonna be all right-- and nothing's gonna happen to me. 
[260]Hey--where you goin'-- 
[261]What the fuck you doin'? 
[262]All right. Why don't you just calm down and think about it a little. 
[263]You think about it, you'll feel different. You'll understand. And in time, we'll look back on all this and you'll see I was right. Look--I love you. Why don't you go get some rest? 
[264]Thank you, sir. I'm gonna try and do my part too, now. 
[265]"I, Robert Green, hereby pledge and 
[266]"--that I will support and defend the Constitution, both of the United States government and the State of New York, to the best of my ability..." 
[267]"...I will faithfully discharge my duties in the rank of rider in the New York City Police Department. So help me God." 
[268]Thanks.   I'll call her back. 
[269]Could you guys go outside for a minute? I wanna talk to my brother. 
[270]You're trying to do everything-- it's gonna kill you. 
[271]We could handle it. I mean, I come on to help you-- 
[272]I know. But you don't gotta do everything yourself. That's what I'm trying to tell you. 
[273]Joe, what's wrong? Come on, you can tell me. A deal this big, something's gonna come up. You'll see--someone'll fold. 
[274]Nah, you didn't do nothing. It's meant to be. You can't fuckin' control it... 
[275]Tell her I'm on my way back now. Don't worry. 
[276]That's all in the past. I'll see you later. 
[277]What happened--where'd she go?!? 
[278]We gotta go find her! 
[279]
[280]Go `head!   Keep me in here--KEEP ME 
[281]You gonna keep me here? HUH?!? 
[282]It's me, Lou. 
[283]I'm okay. Listen uh, you ain't spoke to Rosario lately, have you? 
[284]Thanks... You know, things are really changing on my end. I ain't gonna be in protection anymore. 
[285]...I, I don't know... 
[286]No... 
[287]Jumbo, I don't want nothing right now--don't worry about it. 
[288]Okay, Eli.   Tell him I'll come up. 
[289]Rosario--Rosario's gone down to Florida for a little while. 
[290]Yeah... You know, I was just thinking `bout when I first met her here... Working back there... 
[291]Louis--? How'd you know where I was staying? 
[292]How'd you know where I was staying? 
[293]It wasn't in no papers, Louis. Don't make me embarrass you. Let's go outside, right now. 
[294]Where's Nezhinski? 
[295]Don't play games with me, Louis. 
[296]I just said, DO NOT PLAY GAMES WITH 
[297]You don't mean nothing to me now-- that part of my life is dead. Today it ended for good... 
[298]You know my father is dead because of you? 
[299]You know I'm on the Force now? And I could do anything to you? 
[300]You tell me what you know right now or I swear to Christ I will make you disappear. 
[301]You tell me, right now-- Where's your fuckin' spot?!? 
[302]Well, he said tomorrow and that's what matters. 
[303]They got one year of experience, repeated 25 times. 
[304]Pop would never bring `em in, Joe. We gotta see this through ourselves... 
[305]All right, c'mon. Enough... 
[306]We're gonna get all of `em today. 
[307]Lookit the two of them...they're so fuckin' close... 
[308]You're surrounded by the police! Come out now, with your hands on your heads! 
[309]Joe?! 
[310]Arright, just stay down! 
[311]Vadim is in here with us. Radio our guys, tell `em to get into the clearing. 
[312]Are all our guys out? 
[313]Burn it. 
[314]I'm not gonna let him get away... 
[315]Get down!   On the ground! 
[316]Put him in the fuckin' van... Don't touch him... 
[317]Hey everybody... 
[318]All right.   We'll talk about that after. 
[319]They're getting started--we should probably go in now. 
[320]I don't think he'd believe it... But I guess things don't always go the way you think they will. 
[321]You definitely gonna leave? Ain't no way you change your mind? 
[322]Listen, we'll spend some more time together from now on. Okay? I'll come over next week. 
[323]Chaplain? I'd like you to introduce me this way. If you don't mind. 
[324]Love you too, Joe.
dialogues.JOSEPH GRUSINSKY:
[1]Pop, they got enough! What're you doin'?!? 
[2]He ain't gonna come. 
[3]How you doing... 
[4]Feels like nothin'. Nah, it feels good! I love trying to, you know, help make the City safer for people and everything... 
[5]Bobby, hey! You, you got off work and everything-- 
[6]Bobby, I asked Pop to bring you here. 
[7]Well... I'm gonna be heading up a new narcotics team, starting this week. A Russian unit, outta PSA 2 in Brighton. 
[8]Yeah, they need me over there. There's only eleven guys in the whole department that even know the language right now, so... 
[9]Bobby, we need you to do us a favor. 
[10]
[11]We're looking at this guy Vadim Nezhinski. 
[12]He's dealing H, cocaine, angel dust... Operates out of that club you manage. The El Caribe. 
[13]No, we know that. We checked up and down the rest of management, too--his uncle, the owner-- 
[14]Everybody come up clean. It's just Nezhinski we're lookin' at. 
[15]We need to track how he's bringin' in the product and...we were just hopin' you'd keep your eyes and ears open a little. 
[16]No, we would never ask you to do that. Just observe, that's all. It's a closed community and you're our only way in right now-- 
[17]Nothing's gonna get fucked up, Bobby. All it takes is one thing, you know that! One guy to flip, we crack the whole thing! 
[18]Whole city's falling apart, Bobby-- don't you got any sense of responsibility at all? 
[19]Thanks for coming. 
[20]Just be careful out there next coupla weeks. 
[21]Thank you everybody for coming-- happy Thanksgiving. Before I say anything else... We got some bad news this morning. 
[22]One of our Irish brothers was killed in the line of duty last night--detective Edward Conlon was gunned down serving a warrant on Northern Boulevard. The clock's about to strike ten, so I thought we might give a moment of silence to remember. 
[23]Good. I just wanna make sure we take it easy in there. We don't want no panic. 
[24]It's his day off. He ain't gonna be there. 
[25]Everybody! Get your hands on your head and don't fuckin' move! Turn off that music. Right now! 
[26]Give everybody a toss. G.Q.-- 
[27]Too much pizza, right there. 
[28]Turn around...    Turn around! 
[29]What is this? Want me to double your money? Huh? 
[30]Okay.   It's doubled now, how's that. 
[31]You got a cross AND a Jewish star on you? 
[32]What's the star for? 
[33]Okay, let's go. You. And you-- You're under arrest, possession and sale of narcotics-- 
[34]Your boy's gonna turn. And then we'll come back for you. 
[35]He stabbed himself, he was a bundle guy. Mighta known how they're movin' it. See, that's the key-- 
[36]We waited `til it was your day off. We had to go--I'm sorry. 
[37]Nezhinski was seen there, Bobby! What am I supposed to do--announce it in advance, compromise the whole thing? C'mon. 
[38]Yeah, well, I tried. What do you want from me, anyway? You know, you're standing there feeling sorry for yourself, but you wouldn't be in this shit if you didn't fuck around in the first place. 
[39]Bobby, you're the one acting like you're above it all all the time! 
[40]Fuckin' around with your little Puerto Rican all day-- 
[41]You heard me. Have some fucking class for once. 
[42][You] go around like you're a big shot... You're a joke! Grow up already! Fuckin' loser... 
[43]You come at me like that...? Don't come around me no more--I don't wanna have to look at your fuckin' face ever again. 
[44]Do me a favor, don't get involved. We'll pick this up tomorrow. I'm gonna go home. 
[45]Hello? 
[46]Hello...? 
[47]Only when I look at you! 
[48]Hey, Bobby... 
[49]We could do it now if you want, Pop. In the den. 
[50]He ain't gonna be reliable, Pop. 
[51]Where is he? 
[52]I wanna go with you on that. See his fuckin' face. 
[53]That's `cause we got their number one. Dried it up at the source. 
[54]Bobby--you done a lot for us already. You don't gotta get involved in this anymore. Okay? 
[55]This's police business, Pop--you gonna make him an honorary member of the Force now? 
[56]I'll go in the lead car. You stay with him `til we get to the A.D.A.'s. 
[57]He makes a deal today, maybe my brother don't gotta take the stand... Least that's something... 
[58]Stop the fuckin' car! 
[59]...I'll catch `em, Bobby. Don't worry... 
[60]They're gonna need us to identify the body... 
[61]That's right... 
[62]
[63]I'll be ready to come back and head it up. I'll be ready and, and we'll get `em. After the funeral. 
[64]Bobby... I'm real glad you're with me now... 
[65]You know, I was...I was jealous of you, [for a] long time. 
[66]...I always did what Pop wanted. And you were free... 
[67]...It's all right... I'll be all right... 
[68]What about Nezhinski's uncle? That clubowner--Marat Buzhayev? 
[69]It's comin' up quick, we don't know anything... We're gonna lose it... 
[70]I know that. And my family takes the hit--my family... 
[71]We don't got much time...we lose Nezhinski, we're both dead... [The] streets'll get flooded, the whole City's gonna be on fire-- 
[72]Well, I didn't ask you to do that. I don't need your help--I could deal with it on my own. 
[73]It's not that. It's just... You give up what you wanted to do to be here, Bobby. And part of me feels a little responsible. 
[74]You know, I remember when Pop was mad at you, he always used to say you didn't believe in our family. And Mom, she'd protect you. She'd give you those little caramels... Anyway, I knew he was wrong too, but I didn't say nothing. 
[75]Yeah, definitely... We'll get the TAC plan together... And wherever it is, we'll be ready for `em... 
[76]Yeah? 
[77]The deal's closing--let's go! 
[78]You know, I think Pop would be real happy to see you like this. 
[79]Ah, the Force'll treat you good. I'm sure you do very well. 
[80]It's the right thing. It's over for me--I'm out. 
[81]Arright, yeah.    Sounds good. 
[82]I love you, Bobby.
dialogues.ROSARIO DIAZ:
[1]I love you, baby... 
[2]It's Jumbo... We gotta go anyway... 
[3]C'mon. What's the big deal anyway? We'll go in, you say hello, then we'll go. 
[4]Yeah!   Course! 
[5]Yeah, you tol' me a thousand times. But I been with you for two years, Bobby--I should meet `em by now. We goin' in or not? 
[6]What'd he call you? 
[7]Yeah--I see `em! They don't look that bad though, you know? For cops? Who're those other guys? 
[8]I ain't gonna embarrass you. 
[9]Nice to meet you! 
[10]You take a picture, it'll last longer. 
[11]We could stay if you want, baby. They don't like me, I don't care-- you're better than them anyway-- 
[12]I'm gonna be like Madonna. You think I'm like Madonna...? 
[13]We're both Leos, you know. 
[14]I talked to my mother yesterday. She said she'd be okay by herself, so I could move in if I want... 
[15]Your family ain't gonna be too happy, though. I saw how they looked at me. 
[16]Yeah...you know, cops're fucked up. In my neighborhood, if they ain't taking money, they're beating on you for no reason... 
[17]
[18]I got you something. 
[19]Open it up! 
[20]I love you... And someday we're gonna get a big house together, in New Jersey, with a lotta kids... 
[21]Hi, honey! 
[22]It go good upstairs, baby? 
[23]Yeah, I heard. But I need the money right now, Bobby. And I'm not gonna rely on you for 
[24]I love you... 
[25]Baby, you got a little bruise here-- 
[26]Bobby--it's for you! 
[27]Bobby? 
[28]You gotta go see him--be there for him and your father. 
[29]I wanna come too. For you-- 
[30]
[31]I ain't ever gonna say nothing! I just thought...maybe he could cheer you up a little. 
[32]Hey Vadim... We were just gettin' something to eat. 
[33]`Kay... 
[34]Everything okay? They said on the television your brother was doing better. 
[35]Me and my mother, we said a prayer for him. 
[36]Yeah, I guess... 
[37]You thinking about your brother? About your family? There was nothing you could do... 
[38]Bobby? It's all gonna work out... You'll see... 
[39]Bobby--what're you doing here? 
[40]I'm coming home in a little bit. 
[41]Bobby? 
[42]What...? 
[43]But Nezhinski finds out, he'd kill 
[44]But what if something goes wrong? What's gonna happen to you?!? 
[45]Oh my God... 
[46]How could you not even talk to me about it...? 
[47]Bobby, I'm gonna go outside for a minute, have a smoke-- 
[48]Yes... 
[49]`Be right back... 
[50]Bobby, I'm gonna go back to the motel. 
[51]N--I'm gonna go back. 
[52]C'mon, honey--let's dance! 
[53]You don't gotta yell at me, Bobby. 
[54]Wait!   Lemme get my coat at least! 
[55]No! I was just dancing! I didn't say nothing! 
[56]Bobby, what do you want from me? I can't go out, I can't do nothing-- it's like I'm in a jail-- 
[57]It's just, I feel...I feel like it's just you and all those cops all the time. And they look at me like I'm a piece of shit. 
[58]You know, my Aunt's in Miami. We probably could stay with her for a little bit `til we get settled. 
[59]Bobby--I think I left my watch at the hotel-- 
[60]Bobby?   Could I call my mother...? 
[61]Bobby, I don't know if I can be here no more. 
[62]No, I think maybe it's time I leave then--go down to Miami on my own, with my mother. 
[63]You know that's not true, Bobby. They're not after me. 
[64]
[65]No I wouldn't... They know what I was--what I was 
[66]Bobby! 
[67]I gave it all up for you and you changed everything! 
[68]And you were clean, Bobby? We were 
[69]How could you say that...? We had 
[70]No! Now is nothing! Look at what's happened to your family, Bobby--your father, he's dead--look at your brother! It could all happen to you! 
[71]That's what you said before. 
[72]Get off me!   Let me go! 
[73]Get off me! 
[74]Get off me--I don't want it! It's not what I want!
dialogues.BURT GRUSINSKY:
[1]Here, take another one! Get another! 
[2]You want your face out there--it's good exposure. The PC's gonna see this. C'mon. With both kids. 
[3]You see your brother yet? 
[4]He better. 
[5]Hello. 
[6]We gotta talk to you. Alone. 
[7]Your hair's long. 
[8]All right, go downstairs. Lemme talk to him. 
[9]Joseph! 
[10]I knew you wouldn't help us. I told your brother, I said, `no point even bringing him down here.' 
[11]Hold on a second--lemme ask you a question. That girl of yours downstairs--she Puerto Rican? 
[12]She hooking you up? 
[13]Yeah, keep laughing--your mother, rest in peace, I think she was too easy on you. 
[14]Thank you. You know, I used to tell my kids, "work first, play later," and my son Joseph really took it to heart. He's been a real fighter over the years... He overcome his mother's passing, and the dyslexia--eventually wound up graduating John Jay as salutatorian and distinguished himself many times. Anyway, you've shown yourself to be very brave and selfless, and I'm just, I'm very proud here tonight. 
[15]Where you going? I was the one who got you outta there! 
[16]You're a real big shot, aren't you! You see what happened in there last night? Hey--I'm talking to you! 
[17]You know, you and your girlfriend're only getting off `cause of your brother. Up to me, you'd sit in there another couple days. 
[18]Fire you?! From what? Probably the best thing that ever happened to you! 
[19]Don't EVER speak to me like that again. You hear me? I'll rap you right in the mouth! 
[20]You gotta keep your hands up! Keep your hands up! 
[21]Which kid is it? 
[22]No.   Go on, I'll be right out... 
[23]What're you lookin' at?!? It's got nothing to do with you... 
[24]What do you want? You stayed out of it--you got what you wanted. Why don't you go somewhere and pick a fight--you're good at that! 
[25]Nah, I don't want that crap. 
[26]Hello, your honor. Commissioner. Thank you for coming. 
[27]We'll get `em, your honor. I'm gonna come back in and run it myself--we'll get `em. 
[28]I'm working. 
[29]No. They'll be back on the street in a day. We gotta try and catch `em with their hands full--find out where they got the real weight. Then we can move. 
[30]Doesn't matter. It's our only play. 
[31]What're you talkin' about?! C'mon, don't be a first-class schmuck! 
[32]Then we make the time! Look, I want you all to understand something--we don't ever play in the dirt here, okay? Not ever, no matter what! You piss in your pants, you only stay warm for so long. 
[33]Bunch of college boys from Kansas. We protect our own here. 
[34]Forget it, both of you. 
[35]
[36]That's too dangerous for him! We don't know how solid his cover is out there! That girlfriend of yours, she knows about you, right? So can we just get back to the discussion please? 
[37]What? 
[38]Good. I'm glad. But it's not happening. So forget it. 
[39]Don't worry about me, just worry about yourself, arright? Anything happens with your brother I'll call you. Goodbye. 
[40]Goodbye! 
[41]Where's my goddamned kid?!? 
[42]Jesus. 
[43]You guys go on a bust like this and you don't tell me about it? You think I'm born yesterday? 
[44]You're a real comedian! He's gonna need to be in protection now! 
[45]Well, I guess I don't have a say in anything anymore. Anyway... You did it. You did it and it took real balls. But now you're burnt--and we gotta get you someplace safe, keep you under wraps for awhile. 
[46]I'll get them to take care of that. Just go get yourself fixed up-- that's the most important thing. 
[47]Joseph--we got some things we need to discuss, when you get the chance. 
[48]Bobby--you should hear this too, for the trial. 
[49]We're gonna try and turn him, get him to tell us how they're bringing it in. But don't worry--we'll make sure he does plenty of time. 
[50]Well, you marry an ape, you don't complain about the stench of bananas. 
[51]What's that, Bobby? 
[52]I asked him to come in, Joe. If he's gonna have to testify, he should know all this. 
[53]
[54]No--it's better this way. I don't want him sitting around with nothing to do, feeling useless-- 
[55]Hey, c'mere. A lotta people been talking. About how good you did. And I think maybe...considering the alternatives... ...maybe you might wanna think about joining the Department. 
[56]I could pull some strings, get you through the academy with an early 
[57]Wait--Don't go yet-- 
[58]Can't you put some clothes on him? 
[59]Hello?   What's the matter? Huh? 
[60]Jesus! Listen to me--you and Jack get someplace safe. Let ESU take care of it--I'm gonna go get your brother. 
[61]Nezhinski's out. 
[62]Your brother was taking him to the A.D.A. and they got ambushed. They hit three of our guys. 
[63]Your brother's fine. We gotta get you moved--you've been here too long. 
[64]You need to pack up. 
[65]Nah, we're good. It's just, I just realized--I know this neighborhood. I used to come with my father, to work on the plumbing, for the houses--brought me along to do the talking. He only spoke Russian his whole life... Anyway, it's all changed now. 
[66]Arright... 
[67]I don't know... I heard he did good, though. You know, with everything that's happened--who knows? Maybe all this'll bring us closer together someday. 
[68]Once this is over, you and your brother, you'll talk, you'll work things out. 
[69]Bobby--your brother, I think he probably feels a little guilty, with everything you did, with you in protection now... But he appreciates what you've done--I know he does. 
[70]Look, I'm just trying to keep us together here, that's all. That's all I want. 
[71]Okay... We'll move `em to Corona. I'll lead the line.
dialogues.LOUIS FALSETTI:
[1]Okay, Bobkes! Looks like you got everything under control here--so uh, so I'm gonna go outside, take my break! 
[2]Yes, your fuckin' majesty! 
[3]Yeah--let's all play Spin my Pickle! 
[4]Indeed I did, my friend! See, I woulda been here sooner, `cept I hadda go across town, lose all the cops-- 
[5]Shut your mouth! You wouldn't recognize `em--they were, they were all undercover. 
[6]Anyway, I got a little of what everybody asked for here. I got uppers, downers, hash, mescaline, some blow- 
[7]Yeah, you need that, not me! 
[8]And what's with the suit anyway? You look like a monkey in the circus! 
[9]Yeah? Well, you know what you should do, you should turn it into a fag joint and then maybe they'll let ya in! 
[10]My brother! How'd it go? Ho, well! I'm guessing it went pretty good then! 
[11]That's my specialty. I'm whaddaya call, a people person! 
[12]Yeah, no problem--half of `em got rats as pets anyway. 
[13]She's a player, Bob. You know how it goes. 
[14]Bob! You gotta watch your mouth! I mean, he don't scare me, but uh, but trust me, I know. 
[15]I do, I'm serious! Last year, one of his guys was gonna flip? Jesus Christ, what I saw... 
[16]Nezhinski dragged him into the toilet. They stood him up against the wall and held him-- 
[17]They fuckin' pulled down his pants, and I swear to God, Nezhinski just cut it off. 
[18]Worst thing I ever seen in my life, Bob. Anyway, cops found his head in the middle of Brighton Avenue the next day--fuckin' dick was in his mouth. 
[19]Yeah, that's funny. You sure it wasn't your mouth? 
[20]Jesus, that cop's crazy! 
[21]I got a bruise too, you know--right here! 
[22]So Bob, I think we fold. We fold, right? 
[23]We will? 
[24]Bobkes, I love you! 
[25]I was the one told him to keep goin'! 
[26]Bobkes--?   What's wrong? 
[27]Sure, Bob. Everything cool? 
[28]Take it easy, TAKE IT EASY! Calm down and everything'll be, uh, non compos mentis! 
[29]Where'd you run off to, like a Jew? You got outta there, it became like a real zoo. The spics-- `Scuse me--the P.R.s, they're goin' nuts for the money--picka picka picka picka--and the girls, they're screamin', and I'm keepin' everybody in line. I'm fuckin' bustin' heads, like Bruce Lee--I'm fuckin' bustin' heads-- 
[30]Oh, `scuse me, sorry about that. 
[31]Arright. But I'll tell you Bobkes, nobody else could ever do for you what I did. 
[32]Bobkes! My brother! I been calling you all week! Where you been?!? We missed you!!! 
[33]Yeah well, without you around I hadda lower myself here by hangin' out with Freddie! 
[34]Bobkes!!! 
[35]Sure, Bobkes. I mean, she come here. 
[36]You know Bob, everyone's been askin' `bout you. We was all real surprised to hear about your family- -I mean, your father's like J. Edgar Hoover-- 
[37]HEY!!!!   Bobkes!!! How you doin'?! 
[38]No. She's holed up with you, ain't she?--God knows where. 
[39]Well, I talk to her, I'll tell her you called. 
[40]Oh Bob! That's great! Whaddaya say we knock back a few in your Dad's memory tonight? 
[41]Come on! El Caribe's got their masquerade party--every third drink's free. Be like old times! I'll be there--what more could ask for! C'mon! You comin'? Huh? You gonna be a man or not? 
[42]My brother!   The Grand Return! 
[43]You ain't heard from Rosario yet? 
[44]You want Hazel here to fix you up with a little something? I'm only kiddin'--let's have a drink-- Hey Natasha, over there! 
[45]And you're already acting like a pain in my ass! I can hold my liquor and yours! 
[46]Bob, you all right? 
[47]Florida? Well, she probably just needed a little time for herself. She'll be back. 
[48]Ah, don't worry, Bob. I have no doubt she'll be back. 
[49]I mean, between you and me, that place they had you in was drivin' her crazy. The Kew Motor Inn--we used to call that the SCREW Motor Inn, with all the hookers... Get that waitress wouldja? 
[50]Huh? 
[51]It was, it was in the papers... 
[52]I don't know-- 
[53]But I don't kn-- 
[54]Bob, we're, we're buddies--we're like brothers! C'mon! 
[55]Bobby I swear--I don't know nothing! 
[56]No, wait! Bob, please! Don't do this to me... Don't do this to me Bob, please... 
[57]Bobby, I... I told `em where you were--but, but it ain't what you think! I was makin' a buy and these guys in hoods, they held a gun to my head--so I tried to give `em the wrong information! 
[58]No, wait, listen! It's true! Rosario tol' me you moved every couple days, she said you was gonna move--I thought you'd be gone by then! It's the truth, Bobby! I would never try and hurt you! Never, swear to God!
dialogues.MICHAEL SOLO:
[1]In a house of God, no less? C'mon, get up... 
[2]Hello, Bobby. Nice suit you got on. 
[3]Bobby, it's important. These ain't dumb guys we're talking about. We don't stop `em up front, coupla years from now, it'll be chaos out there. We'd be wishing the Italians'd come back. 
[4]The spot's got one main entrance, two rear fire exits. All of `em'll be covered. 
[5]What if he is?    We still go? 
[6]What's it gonna be? 
[7]You got anything in there? 
[8]Coupla dimes on `em--cocaine, a little PCP. 
[9]I don't know, Joe--forgive me, but uh, your brother... Ever since your mother got sick-- 
[10]Bobby, it's Michael Solo--I got some bad news. Your brother's been shot. He's at St. John's--they're workin' on him now. I just thought you should know. 
[11]Listen, your father's coming--I gotta go. But he's at St. John's. 
[12]The shot went in his cheek and come out through the jaw. It missed his brain, thank God. 
[13]He was real lucky--considering. 
[14]Bobby--that ain't a good idea. I probably should've told you not to come down here--there're a lotta things going on right now. 
[15]Listen, I ain't judging you--I called you `cause I thought you had a right to know. But we're gonna be going hard after Nezhinski--and maybe some other people you're close to. Like that girl you know-- 
[16]Jesus Christ, you gotta be kidding me! 
[17]Nezhinski got a hit list? On us?!? 
[18]We gotta go bust `em, Burt--right now. 
[19]That could take us forever! 
[20]What about callin' in the Feds? They got a lot more juice than we 
[21]How you know about that, Bobby? 
[22]Well, maybe that's it, then. If we can get him-- To set something up, maybe one of our uncles could move in-- 
[23]You'd go set up a buy with `em, just like they've been asking you to. We follow you to the spot, bust `em a week later. That way, your name's clean, nobody knows you're involved-- 
[24]Yeah. Your father's still with him- -we were just gonna go back to the PSA. Try and figure out a tac plan on Nezhinski. 
[25]We don't got much yet, but we'll do our best. You all right? 
[26]
[27]It's too dangerous--you heard your father. 
[28]If anything went wrong, he'd never forgive us. 
[29]We'll get it back for you. 
[30]Now listen: from now on, you'll get all your information through this, at an undisclosed location. Your contact with us is over after you leave here. 
[31]Just be smart about things. Okay? You get burnt and we gotta put you in protection, it's still better than winding up dead. An informant dies, they talk about you for a day. A week later, ain't no one remembers your name. Moral of the story is, don't die. You understand? 
[32]She won't be a target. Just make sure she don't open her mouth. 
[33]You know we known you your whole life, kid? Good luck. 
[34]Hands on your heads! On the floor! 
[35]I guess we do. 
[36]Nezhinski's cache was huge, about 40 keys--yayo, some angel dust too. 
[37]I'll tell you, though--streets're dead. Junkies're waitin' out there for something big, no question. 
[38]We gotta get you to a secure location, Bobby-- 
[39]He's taking it very hard. They had to sedate him. 
[40]You and your brother don't gotta worry about any of that. Just take the time you need-- 
[41]You're a civilian, Bobby. Ain't no way. 
[42]Bobby, come on--you got your own life to live-- 
[43]Then you gotta understand--this ain't something you do just for a vendetta. You gotta go back to the Academy when you're done, you gotta commit yourself. 
[44]Gimme a couple days--I'll talk to the P.C. 
[45]Well, you tell Narcotics Queens we got an A-1 sale hanging over our head and either they help us or we fuckin' take it out on `em later! 
[46]Joe--this is still new territory for all of us. I mean, we hadda use your brother here to get any results to begin with. 
[47]They're movin' serious weight, we might be talkin' major league firepower. Maybe we call in the Feds. 
[48]Each one of `em's got 25 years on the job with this kinda thing, Pudge. 
[49]Arright, guys.    That's it for now. 
[50]Okay--when they complete the sale, that's when we move. ESU'll grab the kids. 
[51]This's too dangerous. We'll all wind up killing each other-- 
[52]Bobby?   What're you doin'-- 
[53]I just saw the commissioner. A lotta people're gonna wanna talk to you--important people. About maybe settin' you up with your own unit.
dialogues.VADIM NEZHINSKI:
[1]Bobby--c'mon, join us! I wanna talk to you! 
[2]This is the fuckin' guy right here. Practically owns the place. 
[3]Everything all right with you? 
[4]That's real good... `Cause you gotta be happy, you know? All my guys, I tell `em, the mind and the body, they're connected. That's how you stay sharp. 
[5]You know Bobby, my uncle upstairs, he, he likes you a lot. Practically thinks you're one of his kids. 
[6]Yeah... Smart smart stupid. Got his head buried in books all day, `stead of the real world... 
[7]Listen uh, I come to you, I tell you I got some friends bringin' a load in here, maybe something big-- I'm just talking now--they bring it in, how do you feel about that? 
[8]Well, upstairs don't gotta know everything, am I right? Place gets packed every night, everybody wins. 
[9]You know, you should think about comin' in with us. You're popular-- you could help us...expand a little. A lotta money in it. 
[10]Go ahead.   We'll talk. 
[11]The cross is for good luck. 
[12]That one's for God. 
[13]Get us onto the expressway... Move! 
[14]Hey, look who's here! 
[15]You make it through that bust okay? 
[16]Glad to hear it. 
[17]He does what he gotta do, I do what I gotta do. He don't own me. 
[18]You know-- 
[19]We got a lot of muscle behind us. Lotta muscle. 
[20]That's right. 
[21]Bobby, those cops--they, they ain't no problem. 
[22]You see this? I got this on the inside, at Tchita. You earn these. So don't worry--we'll get `em all. Cut off the head, the body'll fall, right? You keep on doin' it `til they get the message. We got all their names. On a list. 
[23]What's the matter, ain't Pavel good enough for you? 
[24]Where'd you get this? 
[25]That buys you three keys in here. With the crack on the street, it's worth two hundred k. Maybe more. 
[26]All the shit I get here is at least eighty-six percent pure. And we got a lot more comin' in--a LOT more. In a way nobody could ever trace. 
[27]The whole city'll be sucking our glass soon--you'll see. We push the Guineas out, the Domos'll work for us. 
[28]You're breathing heavy. 
[29]You know, I seen fighters--they breathe like that, means they get nervous. You nervous? 
[30]You got both matches and a lighter. 
[31]He got a wire! Kill this motherfucker, right now! 
[32]Don't shoot! 
[33]He is a dead man... 
[34]They did good.    On his face. 
[35]The rest of the product is in the van--total weight, 75 kilos. 
[36]Don't...don't let me die in here...
dialogues.MARAT BUZHAYEV:
[1]Bobby!   Come here! 
[2]Yes, good. You take care of things good for us... 
[3]Next week, you come by--we talk. Okay? We talk about plans for you. 
[4]Yes, it's good... 
[5]You know, maybe we open another spot next year. Across from Brighton. 
[6]We need someone in charge here full- time, then. And we think you do a great job. 
[7]My son-in-law, he worries people take advantage of me. 
[8]Yes. Together we do it. You come to our Thanksgiving again, on Thursday? 
[9]Good--we talk more, at the dinner. 
[10]Give him, for tonight! 
[11]No no--it's okay. Say hello... 
[12]Now--we go this week to the field, okay? To ride the horses? Go to Mama. 
[13]It's not your fault... 
[14]You can't always control everyone in your family... My nephew, he don't come back to the club anymore. 
[15]We need time for the bad publicity to go away. 
[16]I know.   I don't worry about any of that. 
[17]I used to teach chemistry before I come over here, and now I have the fur store, and this. One thing I learned here, you can always start over. So don't worry--someday, we do it. Okay? Someday. 
[18]You take some time off, everything will be fixed in a little bit. Then you come back. I pay you for the time. Come on... 
[19]We heard all about you in the news. We were all very sorry about your brother. 
[20]I could talk to him. I think he would like you very much. 
[21]We're going to be very sad if you're going. Having you here in this house meant a lot to us. You know, my wife and me, we have only daughters. 
[22]Bobby--you'll always be welcome back here. 
[23]Good evening. My name is Marat Buzhayev, and I'm the owner of the El Caribe. We have a special night, tonight--the Odessa Dance Troop is here to perform for us. I know you'll enjoy it. 
[24]We also have an old friend who's come back to us--I want him to stand--Bobby? Ladies and gentlemen, Bobby Green, who used to be our manager here... 
[25]This's what we've been planning for for so long. My nephew has stayed just to see this through. 
[26]When this is done, we'll control almost the whole market. Each load is completely untraceable. It's my own method. 
[27]Bobby--I, I didn't know it would be your family--
dialogues.JACK SHAPIRO:
[1]I'm old-fashioned. I listen first. 
[2]What if your brother's inside? 
[3]I say we go hit `em all. Wipe `em out, suicide-by-cop-- 
[4]But we don't got the time to infiltrate `em-- 
[5]It'd have to be him-- 
[6]Hold it right there! Hands on your head! 
[7]He's at Rikers. Tucked in, nice and comfy. We're taking him to the A.D.A. next week, for a meeting. 
[8]You got it... 
[9]Shut your fuckin' mouth. 
[10]Give me that lighter. 
[11]No I.D. on the guys in the car. Probably illegals. But Mike-- --We had that place locked up tight. How they knew where they were, I go no idea. 
[12]All our uncles on the street been hearing about a big deal, goin' down maybe Monday or Tuesday. They don't know where yet, but...we got a feeling--[now that] Nezhinski's out, he's gonna be there. 
[13]Everybody's out there, bustin' balls, left and right! What else you want us to do? 
[14]Clean. We tailed him for weeks. Goes out with his grandkids, takes `em horseriding at Floyd Bennett Field... Checks on his fur business from time to time--we even looked at some of the coats and tore `em apart. Turned out to be fake sable, if you could believe it. 
[15]The Feds? 
[16]Bobby's right. 
[17]
[18]You know, they're laughin' at us, out there on the street. Now when we get there, it'll be up to you what we do. But I hope you think about droppin' the hammer on `em. 
[19]I mean--after your father and everything? These people're like fuckin' lice. Just think about what I'm saying to you. 
[20]Stop!   Halt! 
[21]We got the old man--Buzhayev. Up by the cars. His grandkids are safe--they're in the van.
dialogues.PAVEL LUBYARSKY:
[1]This's "Kid Quick" you're talking to, dude. Best fuckin' middleweight in the Ukraine. 
[2]Police are a fuckin' joke, dude-- the Mickey Mouse ain't gonna do nothing. 
[3]How much we talkin' `bout here, dude? 
[4]Oh, [the] man's gonna be good with that. How `bout tomorrow night? 
[5]Arright. We'll meet at El Caribe, `round midnight? That way, you could dance a little, say hi to your girlfriend... 
[6]Oh, he don't come in here no more-- 
[7]Be on the boardwalk in a hour... 
[8]And dude--this don't shake out... 
[9]Get in! 
[10]Put your hands out, where I could see `em. 
[11]Shut your fuckin' mouth and do it! 
[12]Turn at the light... 
[13]Go left.    Again. 
[14]What you say...?
dialogues.SPIRO GIAVANNIS:
[1]Everyone?   Everyone! 
[2]I'm Deputy Commissioner Spiro 
[3]You know, we look around in these troubled times, and in moments like this we need leaders, men and women who can bring order back to our great communities. We're here this holiday season to give thanks for one of these men, our Russian brother, Joseph Grusinsky. 
[4]...Joseph, many of us've known your father, Deputy Chief Burt Grusinsky, for many years, and I know he wants to say a little something. Chief? 
[5]Bobby, hi! Spiro Giavannis, Deputy Commissioner. Glad to see you made it out here today! 
[6]How's the leg treating you? 
[7]You got any idea what you're gonna be doing after the trial? 
[8]Gee, that's great. Well listen, you need any help, you give us a call. `Cause we can be part of your family too. 
[9]The Commissioner is here now, and he's ready to go.
dialogues.GUARD:
[1]Sorry. Nobody's allowed in except immediate family. 
[2]You got some I.D.? 
[3]Says here your name is "Green." 
[4]I'm sorry. 
[5]Hey! 
[6]One more minute, Chief. 
[7]She left about an hour ago.   She said to give you this-- 
[8]She asked us not to, Bobby. She's-- Bobby--we can't do that legally!
dialogues.UNIFORMED COP:
[1]Hey! I saw that! Get your hands on your fuckin' head! 
[2]Jessie!   This one just ingested! 
[3]Hey! Fat Albert! Shut your fuckin' mouth! 
[4]Russian guy fuckin' slashed himself! 
[5]Chief...? 
[6]You want us to contact your other son--?
